meanings.definition: To rearrange or shuffle in a different order.
meanings.sent1: She was rejuggling her schedule to fit in the new meeting.
meanings.sent2: I need to rejuggle the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The magician was rejuggling the cards, making them disappear and reappear.
meanings.sent4: He rejuggled his priorities, putting family first.
meanings.sent5: The student was rejuggling her study notes to ace the exam.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the order or arrangement of something.
meanings.sent1: The rejuggling of the furniture made the room feel more spacious.
meanings.sent2: After the rejuggling of the seating plan, everyone had a new partner.
meanings.sent3: The rejuggling of the books on the shelf created a colorful pattern.
meanings.sent4: The rejuggling of the schedule caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent5: The rejuggling of the puzzle pieces revealed the hidden picture.
